/wiki/Ranong_Province: Ranong ( Thai : ระนอง [ rá.nɔ̄ːŋ ] , Southern Thai : ระนอง [ ra.nɔːŋ ] ) is one of Thailand 's southern provinces ( changwat ) , on the west coast along the Andaman Sea . It has the fewest inhabitants of all Thai provinces . Provinces neighboring Ranong are ( clockwise ) Chumphon , Surat Thani , and Phang Nga . To the west , it borders Kawthaung , Tanintharyi , Myanmar .
/wiki/Mu_Ko_Phayam: Mu Ko Phayam is a group of islands in Ranong Province , Thailand . They are mostly tourist islands and are pristine and quiet , relaxed , as opposed to Ko Samui or Ko Phangan . The capital of this group is the Megon village of Mea Mei . There are about 30 islands with a size of 45 km² and population of 1172 divided between the 2 tambons of Ko Phayam and Bang Rin of Mueang Ranong District .
/wiki/Mu_Ko_Kom: Mu Ko Kam ( Thai : หมู่เกาะกำ ) is a group of Islands in Ranong Province , Thailand .
/wiki/Phang_Nga_Province: Phang Nga ( Thai : พังงา pronounced [ pʰāŋ.ŋāː ] , Southern Thai : พังงา pronounced [ pʰaŋ.ɧaː ] , RTGS : Phangnga ) is one of the southern provinces ( changwat ) of Thailand , on the shore of the Andaman Sea to the west and Phang Nga Bay to the south . Neighboring provinces are ( from north , clockwise ) Ranong , Surat Thani , and Krabi . To the south is the Phuket Province , connected by the Sarasin Bridge .
/wiki/Surin_Island: The Surin Islands ( Thai : หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์ , Thai pronunciation : [ mùː kɔ̀ʔ sùrin ] ) is an archipelago of five islands in the Andaman Sea , 60 km from the Thai mainland . Administratively , the islands are part of Tambon Ko Phra Thong , Khura Buri District , in Phang Nga Province , Thailand . [ citation needed ] Mu Ko Surin National Park ( อุทยานแห่งชาติหมู่เกาะสุรินทร์ ) encompasses the islands and their surrounding waters . The park covers an area of approximately 141.25 km2 . It contains the Surin Islands and the surrounding waters . Of the protected area , 108 km2 or 80 percent is ocean . The park was gazetted as the 29th national park of Thailand on 9 July 1981 . The park is closed during rainy season , 1 May-31 October , every year .
/wiki/Ko_Surin_Tai: The Surin Islands ( Thai : หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์ , Thai pronunciation : [ mùː kɔ̀ʔ sùrin ] ) is an archipelago of five islands in the Andaman Sea , 60 km from the Thai mainland . Administratively , the islands are part of Tambon Ko Phra Thong , Khura Buri District , in Phang Nga Province , Thailand . [ citation needed ] Mu Ko Surin National Park ( อุทยานแห่งชาติหมู่เกาะสุรินทร์ ) encompasses the islands and their surrounding waters . The park covers an area of approximately 141.25 km2 . It contains the Surin Islands and the surrounding waters . Of the protected area , 108 km2 or 80 percent is ocean . The park was gazetted as the 29th national park of Thailand on 9 July 1981 . The park is closed during rainy season , 1 May-31 October , every year .

/wiki/Ko_Klang: Ko Klang ( Thai : เกาะกลาง ) is in tambon Klong Prasong , Mueang Krabi District , Krabi Province , Thailand .
/wiki/Similan_Islands: The Similan Islands ( Thai : หมู่เกาะสิมิลัน , Thai pronunciation : [ mùː kɔ̀ʔ si.mi.lan ] , Malay : Pulau Sembilan ) is an archipelago in the Andaman Sea off the coast of , and part of , Phang Nga Province , in southern Thailand . It is a national park , Mu Ko Similan , which was established in 1982 after a one-year assessment by the forestry department .
